lyrics:
I still remember the third of December, me in your sweater
You said it looked better on me than it did you
Only if you knew how much I liked you

But I watch your eyes as she

Walks by
What a sight for sore eyes
Brighter than the blue sky
She′s got you mesmerized while I die

Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it′s just polyester
But you like her better
Wish I were Heather

Watch as she stands with her, holding your hand
Put your arm 'round her shoulder, now I'm getting colder
But how could I hate her? She′s such an angel
But then again, kinda wish she were dead as she

Walks by
What a sight for sore eyes
Brighter than the blue sky
She′s got you mesmerized while I die

Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it′s just polyester
But you like her better
I wish I were Heather

(Oh, oh)

I wish I were Heather
(Oh, oh)

Wish I were Heather

Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it′s just polyester

But you like her better
Wish I were
imageDescription: The image that best represents the song "Heather" is a girl watching from a distance as her crush and another girl walk hand in hand. The girl she idolizes, Heather, is depicted as a radiant figure with a glowing aura, contrasting against the plain and cold surroundings. The girl watching feels invisible and wishes she could be like Heather, wishing for her beauty and the affection her crush gives to her.
